bill.title: Child Support Enforcement
bill.description: Includes the date that services for remuneration were first performed as information to be provided to the child support enforcement agency through the new hire reporting process. Requires employers or unions to provide the appropriate health plan provider a notice of medical support within a certain time frame. (SB2703 HD1)

history.action: (S) Introduced.
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 02-17-12 10:00AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara.
(S) Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2454) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 03-06-12.
(S) Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 268) in amended form (SD 1).
(H) Pass First Reading
(H) Referred to HUS, JUD, referral sheet 41
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by HUS on Thursday, 03-15-12 9:00AM in House conference room 329.
(H) Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

(H) The committees on HUS recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 6 Ayes: Representative(s) Mizuno, Jordan, C. Lee, Morikawa, Wooley, Yamane; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Hanohano, Ching, Pine.
(H) Reported from HUS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1123-12), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 03-27-12 2:00PM in House conference room 325.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Herkes, Luke, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Marumoto, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 5 Excused: Cabanilla, Carroll, Coffman, Ito, McKelvey.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1505-12) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Third Reading.

(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 383).
(S) Deferred until 04-12-12.
(S) Senate disagrees with House amendments.
